- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).

-->

## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
$host.UI.RawUI.ForegroundColor = "Red"
```

## Expected behavior

```none
Powershell foreground text color should change to Red
```

## Actual behavior

```none
Powershell foreground text color actually changes to White. Command works with other colors, just not Red.
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2094779/105193801-e8499580-5b06-11eb-863d-a38473aa430d.png)

Also note, Red is listed in the list of valid colors:

```powershell
PS C:\> [enum]::GetNames([consolecolor])
Black
DarkBlue
DarkGreen
DarkCyan
DarkRed
DarkMagenta
DarkYellow
Gray
DarkGray
Blue
Green
Cyan
Red
Magenta
Yellow
White
PS C:\>
```
And attempting to change the color to an invalid color correctly returns an error

```powershell
PS C:\> $host.UI.RawUI.ForegroundColor = "Invalid"
SetValueInvocationException: Exception setting "ForegroundColor": "Cannot convert value "Invalid" to type "System.ConsoleColor". Error: "Unable to match the identifier name Invalid to a valid enumerator name. Specify one of the following enumerator names and try again:
Black, DarkBlue, DarkGreen, DarkCyan, DarkRed, DarkMagenta, DarkYellow, Gray, DarkGray, Blue, Green, Cyan, Red, Magenta, Yellow, White""
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->
```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19042

PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
